node.title: Antarctic penguin arrives on Canterbury beach in extremely rare occurrence
node.description: It's understood the bird is currently receiving care before being released back into the wild.
node.content: ["A young penguin is a long way from home after braving an intensive journey from the icy terrain of Antarctica to New Zealand's sandy shores, arriving at Birdlings Flat Beach in Canterbury this week in an extremely rare occurrence.\u00a0\u00a0", "On Wednesday evening, local resident Harry Singh had been strolling along the beach, about 46 kilometres south of Christchurch, when he came across the Antarctic or Ad\u00e9lie penguin, a species native to the ice-covered continent.\u00a0", "According to an online encyclopedia of New Zealand birds, Ad\u00e9lie penguins are rarely recorded far from the Antarctic coast or sea-ice and are \"very rare vagrants\" to mainland New Zealand. As reported by the encyclopedia, there are only two other documented instances of an Ad\u00e9lie penguin arriving on Aotearoa's shores - an adult corpse was discovered north of the Flaxbourne River mouth in Marlborough in December 1962, and a live bird was found in Kaikoura in January 1993.", "Singh, who was quick to share footage of the special encounter to social media, noticed the penguin was not returning to the water. Posting to Facebook, Singh said he and his wife remained at the beach for more than four hours to monitor the bird, which he said was \"continuously eating stones\".\u00a0", "\"[We] did not want it to end up in a cat or dog's stomach,\" he said.", "After a few hours, Singh started to search for specialised rescuers on his phone and eventually made contact with Thomas Stracke, who operates a Christchurch-based rehabilitation service for sick and injured penguins in the Canterbury region. He has been caring for penguins for more than 10 years.", "Singh later confirmed on Facebook that Stracke had picked up the penguin and had taken some blood for testing. Footage posted to Singh's Facebook shows the penguin bundled in a blanket-lined container and being placed in the back of the car.", "Speaking to Stuff, Stracke said he \"never expected\" for the penguin to be an Ad\u00e9lie when he received Singh's call on Wednesday evening.", "\"I was quite surprised,\" he said.\u00a0\"It probably just lost its way.\"", "Stracke arranged a vet to accompany him and drove down to Birdlings Flat, arriving at the beach at about 10pm where Singh was still waiting.", "He told Stuff he believes the penguin is about one to two years old but is unsure of the gender. The\u00a0blood test indicated the penguin is slightly underweight and dehydrated, he said, but otherwise appears in good health. The Department of Conservation has been notified.\u00a0", "Stracke told the outlet the penguin will soon be released to a safe stretch of shoreline on Banks Peninsula - when the little penguin returns to the sea will be decided by the vet, he said.\n", "A spokesperson for the Department of Conservation confirmed to Newshub the penguin is in the care of the experienced rescuer and they are currently getting an update on the next steps for the Ad\u00e9lie."]
